explanation: The NDA defines the group to whom Confidential Information may be disclosed as the Receiving Party’s “Representatives,” listing only directors, officers, employees, advisors, legal counselors, consultants and agents. It makes no mention of Affiliates, does not state that Affiliates are parties to the Agreement, and does not expressly permit disclosure to them under obligations equivalent to those in the NDA. Because the contract fails to clarify the status of Affiliates or authorize their receipt of Confidential Information, it does not satisfy the rule that requires such clarification.
rule: Clarify whether affiliates of the parties are included as parties to the NDA or are permitted to receive Confidential Information.
exampleLanguage: The Receiving Party may disclose Confidential Information to its Affiliates, provided that such Affiliates are bound by confidentiality obligations no less restrictive than those contained in this Agreement. The Receiving Party shall remain fully responsible for ensuring that its Affiliates comply with these obligations.
